alert.note: Alert for Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 5:34PM EDT until June 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Lebanon. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 533 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This area received heavy rainfall earlier today. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Lebanon, Myerstown, Sand Hill, Newmanstown, Avon, Richland, Fredericksburg, Schaefferstown, Jonestown and Avon Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
